ЁЯМ╛
Sons of the Kaveri

The early Cholas ruled over the fertile Kaveri Delta. Their early capital was Uraiyur. Karikala Chola was undoubtedly the greatest ruler of this period. Sangam literature vividly describes the prosperity of the Cholas, especially in agriculture and the textile industry.

ЁЯЪв
Puhar: An International Metropolis

Their port city of Puhar (Kaveripattinam) was a cosmopolitan center where traders from various countries resided. The poem 'Pattinappalai' describes the city's markets, tall ships, and palaces. This city was eventually destroyed by a tsunami or sea storms, as mentioned in Manimekalai.

тЪФя╕П
Politics and Warfare

The Sangam Cholas were in constant warfare with the neighboring Chera and Pandya kings. King Peru-narkilli performed the Rajasuya Yajna. After the 3rd century CE, they declined due to the Kalabhra invasion and disappeared into obscurity until the 9th century.
